intro: Pectis rigida, commonly known as the rigid pectis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, rigid leaves that are typically gray-green in color, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Pectis rigida is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Its structure and appearance make it a distinctive and resilient plant in its native habitat.
